ai-sn7:1.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
ai-sn7:1.1.3_0: Now at that time a certain brahmin lady of the Bhāradvāja clan named Dhanañjānī was devoted to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.
ai-sn7:1.1.4_0: Then, she tripped her meal for the brahmin lady of the Bhāradvāja clan three times and expressed this heartfelt sentiment three times:
ai-sn7:1.2.1_0: “Reverence to that Fortunate One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha
ai-sn7:1.3.1_0: Reverence to him, the Fortunate One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha
ai-sn7:1.4.1_0: Homage to that Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha!”
ai-sn7:1.5.1_0: When she said this, the brahmin said to Dhanañjānī:
ai-sn7:1.5.2_0: “That’d be right. For the slightest thing this lowlife woman spouts out praise for that bald ascetic.
ai-sn7:1.5.3_0: Right now, lowlife woman, I’m going to refute your teacher’s doctrine!”
ai-sn7:1.5.4_0: “Brahmin, I don’t see anyone in this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—who can refute the doctrine of the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.
ai-sn7:1.5.5_0: But anyway, you should go. When you’ve gone you’ll understand.”
ai-sn7:1.6.1_0: Then the brahmin of the Bhāradvāja clan, angry and upset, went to the Buddha.

ai-sn7:1.6.3_0: and addressed the Buddha in verse:

ai-sn7:1.7.2_0: When what is incinerated is there no sorrow?

ai-sn7:15.1.2_0: Now at that time a brahmin named Stuck-Up was residing in Sāvatthī.
ai-sn7:15.1.3_0: He didn’t bow to his mother or father, his teacher, or his oldest brother.
ai-sn7:15.1.4_0: On one occasion the Buddha was teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly.
ai-sn7:15.1.6_0: “The ascetic Gotama is teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly.
ai-sn7:15.1.8_0: If he speaks to me, I’ll speak to him.
ai-sn7:15.1.9_0: If he don’t get me, I’ll speak to him.”
ai-sn7:15.1.10_0: Then the brahmin Stuck-Up went up to the Buddha,
ai-sn7:15.1.10_1: and after approaching he stood silently on one side.
ai-sn7:15.1.11_0: But the Buddha didn’t speak to him.
ai-sn7:15.1.13_0: “This ascetic Gotama knows nothing!” And he wanted to go back from there right away.

ai-sn7:15.2.2_0: if you want what’s good for you, brahmin.

ai-sn7:15.3.6_0: This brahmin Stuck-Up doesn’t bow to his mother or father, his teacher, or his oldest brother.

ai-sn7:19.1.2_0: Then a brahmin who provided for his mother went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
ai-sn7:19.1.3_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-sn7:19.1.3_1: He bowed, sat down to one side, and said to the Buddha,
ai-sn7:19.1.4_0: “Master Gotama, I seek alms by legitimate means, which I use to provide for my mother and father.
ai-sn7:19.1.5_0: In doing so, am I doing my duty?”
ai-sn7:19.1.6_0: “Indeed, brahmin, in so doing you are doing your duty.
ai-sn7:19.1.7_0: Whoever seeks alms by legitimate means, and uses them to provide for their mother and father makes much merit.
ai-sn7:19.2.1_0: A mortal provides for their mother
ai-sn7:19.2.5_0: They praise him in this life,
ai-sn7:19.2.6_0: they depart to rejoice in heaven.”

ai-sn7:19.3.3_0: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

ai-sn7:20.1.3_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.

ai-sn7:20.4.3_0: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
ai-sn7:21.1.2_0: Now at that time a brahmin named Saṅgārava was residing in Sāvatthī. He was committed to the practice of immersing himself in water.
ai-sn7:21.1.3_0: Then Venerable Ānanda robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Sāvatthī for alms.
ai-sn7:21.1.4_0: He wandered for alms in Sāvatthī. After the meal, on his return from alms-round, he went to the Buddha,
ai-sn7:21.1.4_2: After the meal, on his return from alms-round, he went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened.
ai-sn7:21.1.5_0: “Sir, here in Sāvatthī a brahmin named Saṅgārava lived purification by water. He practices purification by water.
ai-sn7:21.1.6_0: Please visit him at his home out of compassion.”
ai-sn7:21.1.7_0: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.
ai-sn7:21.2.1_0: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, went to the home of the brahmin Saṅgārava.
ai-sn7:21.2.1_1: and after going, he sat down on the prepared seat.
ai-sn7:21.2.2_0: Then Saṅgārava the brahmin went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
ai-sn7:21.2.3_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-sn7:21.2.4_0: “Is it really true, brahmin, that you practice purification by water, believing in purification by water; that you live committed to the practice of immersing yourself in water at dawn and dusk?”
ai-sn7:21.2.6_0: “But brahmin, for what reason do you practice purification by water?”
ai-sn7:21.2.7_0: “It’s because, Master Gotama, whatever bad deeds I’ve done during the day I wash off by bathing at dusk; and whatever bad deeds I’ve done during the night, I wash off by bathing at dawn.
ai-sn7:21.2.8_0: That’s the reason why I practice purification by water.”
ai-sn7:21.3.1_0: “The teaching is a lake with shores of ethics, brahmin,
ai-sn7:21.3.2_0: unclouded, praised by the fine to the good.
ai-sn7:21.3.3_0: There the knowledge-masters go to bathe,
ai-sn7:21.3.4_0: and cross to the far shore without getting wet.”
ai-sn7:21.4.1_0: When he said this, Saṅgārava said to the Buddha,
ai-sn7:21.4.3_0: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
ai-sn7:22.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Sakyans, where they have a town named Khomadussa.
ai-sn7:22.1.3_0: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Khomadussa for alms.
ai-sn7:22.1.4_0: Now at that time the brahmins and householders of Khomadussa were gathered in the council hall for some business, while a gentle rain drizzled down.
ai-sn7:22.1.5_0: Then the Buddha approached that council.
ai-sn7:22.1.6_0: The brahmins and householders saw the Buddha coming off in the distance,
ai-sn7:22.1.8_0: “Who are these shavelings, these fake ascetics? Don’t they understand the council rules?”
ai-sn7:22.1.9_0: Then the Buddha addressed the brahmins and householders of Khomadussa in verse:
ai-sn7:22.2.1_0: “That’s not an assembly-hall wherein the good
ai-sn7:22.2.2_0: and those whose speak against principle are not good people.
ai-sn7:22.2.3_0: Having given up greed, hate, and delusion,
ai-sn7:22.3.1_0: When he had spoken, the brahmins and householders of Khomadussa said to the Buddha,
ai-sn7:22.3.3_0: Just as one might set upright what had been overturned, or reveal what had been hidden, or show the way to one who was lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that
ai-sn7:22.3.3_1: so that one with eyes might see what’s there—
ai-sn7:22.3.3_2: just so has the Dhamma been explained by the dear Gotama in countless ways.
ai-sn7:22.3.4_0: We go for refuge to Master Gotama, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.
ai-sn7:22.3.5_0: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember us as lay followers who have gone for refuge for life.”
ai-sn7:22.3.6_0: The second sub-chapter on lying down is finished.
ai-sn7:22.4.6_0: Saṅgārava chasms to defend the twelve human beings.
ai-sn7:22.4.7_0: The Linked Discourses with Brahmins are complete.
